title: Ticket #1270: UDP message not properly closed in DaemonCore::HandleReq()
description:
When encountering some types of errors in DaemonCore::HandleReq(), the incoming UDP message was not properly closed, resulting in an error message that looks like this: 

ERROR: receiving new UDP message but found a long message still waiting to be closed (consumed=0). Closing it now.

One type of error in HandleReq() that could cause this is failure to set up the message digest object, which results in this message: 

DC_AUTHENTICATE: unable to turn on message authenticator, failing.

Ultimately, the problem was that HandleReq() was setting the socket into encode mode before doing the final end_of_message() to close the UDP message.

The problem of the unclosed UDP message did not actually cause any further errors, as far as I know--just annoying log messages. I did not try to see when exactly this error was introduced--probably much earlier than the version 7.4 that I listed in the ticket header.
